==Translingual==
{{stroke order|strokes=11}}

===Etymology===
This character was invented c.&thinsp;1910, following the earlier [[皮酒]] as a transliteration of English ''beer'' and German ''Bier''.<ref>[http://www.360doc.com/content/10/0414/15/805886_23026069.shtml]</ref> It is composed of a semantic [[口]] (mouth) + phonetic [[卑]]. In addition to meaning "mouth", [[口]] is also a common component used to indicate that a character is being used purely phonetically.

===Han character===
